meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be opened.
meanings.sent1: The openability of the jar made it easy to access the cookies inside.
meanings.sent2: The openability of the gate allowed for smooth entry into the garden.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat had such incredible openability that it seemed to produce endless scarves.
meanings.sent4: Her heart had a lock, but his love had the openability to unlock it.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest's openability revealed a dazzling array of jewels and gold.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily opened or accessed.
meanings.sent1: The openability of the book's cover made it simple to start reading.
meanings.sent2: The openability of the package allowed the child to quickly get to the toy inside.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's openability to the bird feeder provided entertainment for the whole family.
meanings.sent4: His mind had an openability to new ideas that sparked creativity in his work.
meanings.sent5: The door's openability was so smooth that it seemed to invite guests inside effortlessly.
